body:
I'd like to think that the Avicus community is pretty mature, so why can swearing end up with an infraction?

Thanks.
body_tagged:
I'd like to think that the Avicus community is pretty mature, so why can swearing end up with an infraction?

Thanks.
title: Why is swearing a punishable offense?

replies.body:
Swearing itself isn't really punishable, it's how you use it.

Swearing excessively in the chat or towards another player is what is not allowed and punishable.
replies.body_tagged:
Swearing itself isn't really punishable, it's how you use it.

Swearing excessively in the chat or towards another player is what is not allowed and punishable.

replies.body:
F*** I fell <-- Allowed
F*** you <-- Not allowed.
replies.body_tagged:
F*** I fell <-- Allowed
F*** you <-- Not allowed.

replies.body: Stupid infraction that I shouldn't of got then...

replies.body: if you were mature, you wouldn't swear.  you would put into account that there could be little kids in the game.  just don't do it and you won't get in trouble.

You can still be mature and swear.
Swearing doesn't define someone's matureness.

replies.body: Ive seen people warned for saying things such as "F*** I FELLL OMGGGG" Not using it towards a player as well.
replies.body_tagged: Ive seen people warned for saying things such as "F*** I FELLL OMGGGG" Not using it towards a player as well.

replies.body:
Swearing does effect how mature you are. People who are mature have self control, which means they refrain themselves from swearing. 

Action will be taken if your language is taken against a certain player, or if it's excessive.
replies.body_tagged:

Action will be taken if your language is taken against a certain player, or if it's excessive.

replies.body: i dont think some 9 year old fresh out of his little league baseball games wants to hear he's a "faggot'

replies.body: If swearing disrupts the game play, or is offending someone, then its punishible.
replies.body_tagged: If swearing disrupts the game play, or is offending someone, then its punishible.

replies.body:
Can agree.

I think as long as it's not toward someone(s), it's allowed.

Can agree.

replies.body:
The rule is:

Swearing is allowed, as long as it does not offend or hurt others.

Just because you swear doesn't mean you're immature; I guarantee a lot peoples parents swear here.
replies.body_tagged:
The rule is:

Swearing is allowed, as long as it does not offend or hurt others.

Just because you swear doesn't mean you're immature; I guarantee a lot peoples parents swear here.

replies.body:
You can be very mature and swear, but to be mature you should know when swearing is a bad idea. There are always going to be people who do swear, not knowing when it's a bad idea because they aren't mature.
Also, saying words like "fu*k", "sh*t", "damn" and "hell" is completely different from saying words like "f*g", "b*tch", the "N" word and other words that have been used to be oppressive and/or offensive. Saying those words can hurt someone in real life and drive them to do very bad things, whereas saying "Fu*k! I died!" is not necessarily bad.
replies.body_tagged:
You can be very mature and swear, but to be mature you should know when swearing is a bad idea. There are always going to be people who do swear, not knowing when it's a bad idea because they aren't mature.
Also, saying words like "fu*k", "sh*t", "damn" and "hell" is completely different from saying words like "f*g", "b*tch", the "N" word and other words that have been used to be oppressive and/or offensive. Saying those words can hurt someone in real life and drive them to do very bad things, whereas saying "Fu*k! I died!" is not necessarily bad.

replies.body:
This is true.

Minecraft is a game of all ages, we can't just assume that all of the players in the game are fine with the language.
